main event: A white, spherical object with an X-pattern of lights was spotted moving slowly over Roslyn Harbor, Long Island, New York on March 3, 1958.
interesting points: The object was approximately 50 to 60 feet in diameter and was observed for 2-3 minutes.
The object was traveling from west to east at a very slow pace, but with no sound observed.
The observer was familiar with aircraft and was not considered excitable, indicating this was an unusual sighting.
The observer also reported seeing elongated lights heading south at high speed.
The sighting was reported to Lt. Col. Hector Quintanilla, the USAF Blue Book Officer.
sighted object: a white, spherical object with an X-pattern of lights
location: Roslyn Harbor, Long Island, New York
